Description: Very small fragment of a seal-impression, a quite thick impression of a string at the side with a width of about 0.37cm. At the rear only a small impression is preserved, showing probably another string. The fine brown Nile clay has inclusions of mica and was hardened after excavation. It shows a crack at the surface and the clay is partly blackened from fire. The top shows a small part of a scarab-like seal impression with a circumferential band. One possible standing figure with a staff is preserved in its lower part.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), E14.7 temple magazine
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
